original: BORGHAMMAR, Harald Anders Thorsten, Direktör, Göteborg, f Jönk 1/11 96 av kont.ch P E Andersson o Augusta Berglund, gm Willy Lundholm. Jkp hal, studex 15, resoff.ut-bildn v Kgl Fortif. Anst Jkps Tändst.fabr 16 —18, insp Försäkr AB Skandia 18—20, eg fma 20—22, åter Försäkr AB Skandia 22—29, org.ch f brandavd Br o Lifförs AB Skåne 29, dir o ch f nmda bolags avd.kont Gbg 38, vkst dir o styr.led Skåne-Malmö Gen.ag i Gbg AB sed. 41. Alltj org.ch f brandavd i Br o Lifförs AB Skåne. Kapt i Kgl Fortif.kårens res 40. Ordf Gbgs Ing.truppsfrn, v. ordf Ing.trupp kamr.frn i Gbg, styr.led Försäkr.frn Gen o Hvdagenter. Medl The Royal Bachelors Club, Par Bricole, Göta Coldinu, Paltgillet mm. Hobby: Färgfotografering. °BORGQUIST, Per-Axel Lionel, Ingenjör, Göteborg, f Gbg 27/2 11 av sjökapt F L B o Edith Kjerstensdtr. GbgReal, CTI (eltekn) lägre avd 28—31, h avd 31—34. Platsing v linjebyggn v Sydsv KraftAB :s Kalmarkont 35, nu anst v AEG-Filialen i Gbg. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: BORGHAMMAR, Harald Anders Thorsten, Director, Gothenburg, born in Jönkoping on November 1, 1896, to accountant P E Andersson and Augusta Berglund, married to Willy Lundholm. Graduated from high school at the age of 15, attended officer training at the Royal Fortification Institute. Worked at Jönköping Match Factory from 1916 to 1918, inspector at Skandia Insurance Company from 1918 to 1920, self-employed from 1920 to 1922, returned to Skandia Insurance Company from 1922 to 1929, became chairman of the fire department at Br and Lifförs AB Skåne in 1929, director and head of department in the branch office in Gothenburg from 1938, promoted to director and board member of Skåne-Malmö General Agency in Gothenburg since 1941. Still serving as chairman of the fire department at Br and Lifförs AB Skåne. Captain in the Royal Fortification Corps since 1940. Chairman of the Gothenburg Engineer Troop Association, vice chairman of the Engineer Troop Chamber Friends in Gothenburg, board member of the General Insurance Company and Head Agents. Member of the Royal Bachelors Club, Par Bricole, Göta Coldinu, Paltgillet, and more. Hobby: Color photography. °BORGQUIST, Per-Axel Lionel, Engineer, Gothenburg, born in Gothenburg on February 27, 1911, son of ship captain F L B and Edith Kjerstensdtr. Attended Gothenburg Real school, studied electrical engineering at CTI from 1928 to 1931, lower division from 1931 to 1934. Employed in line construction at South Swedish Power AB's Kalmar office in 1935, currently employed at the AEG branch in Gothenburg. Member of the Swedish Technical Society.

organization.name: Skåne-Malmö General Agency in Gothenburg AB
